results.title: 70mm cement splicer
results.brief_description:
70mm cement splicer
Richard Brown donation
Made from cast iron and the paint is noticeably flaking off. There is still film in the splicer. There is still a piece of blank film inside it.

results.title: M.2-16mm 2T splicer
results.brief_description:
The splicer, afterwards simply know as the “Catozzo”, was born as a result of a serious form of allergy to the smell of the cement suffered by his inventor which produced the happy intuition to use adhesive tape in its place, for joining the various film ends together.
This idea was subsequently consolidated and patented all over the world, developing into all the various currently existing models. [SOURCE: https://www.cir-srl.com/ last accessed 20/06/2019]

CIR (Costruzione Incollatrici Rapide) Catozzo

Incollatrice M. 2-16mm 2T splicer
with adhesive tape
housed in original cardbox box.

Housed in storage box stamped three times with:
Michael Hudson
Phone 387 4549
Film Production & design
626 Park Street
North Carlton VIC 3054

Included are: Instructions per film 16mm
description of splicers flier that folds out.
Made in Italy. Patented

Label at the bottom of the splicer has been attached which says:
Michael Hudson
Phone 387 4549
Film Production & design
626 Park Street
North Carlton VIC 3054

Inscribed at the base: Made in Italy. US pat

silver label at the base reads:
made in Italy by
Officine Meccaniche
Dr. Leo Catozzo
00050 Santa Severa (Roma)
Tel. 0766/78008-78181

FPB A-2025

results.title: Panasonic VHS-C Movie Camera NV-A1
results.brief_description: The Panasonic VHS-C Movie Camera NV-A1 was a condensed VHS (Video Home System) videocassette format, which was mainly used in consumer-grade camcorders. It was a smaller size than VHS, as with Betamax, but could be played in a standard VCR with an adaptor.
results.description: Various magnetic tape technologies were produced during the period of the videotape format wars during the late 1970s and early 80s, which was particularly significant for the amateur filmmaker market. Cameras became more and more compact, making them cheaper and portable. The Panasonic VHS-C Movie Camera NV-A1 was a condensed VHS (Video Home System) videocassette format, which was mainly used in consumer-grade camcorders. It was a smaller size than VHS, as with Betamax, but could be played in a standard VCR with an adaptor making the footage easier to access than ever before.
description_for_label: Various magnetic tape technologies were produced during the period of the videotape format wars during the late 1970s and early 80s, which was particularly significant for the amateur filmmaker market. Cameras became more and more compact, making them cheaper and portable. The Panasonic VHS-C Movie Camera NV-A1 was a condensed VHS (Video Home System) videocassette format, which was mainly used in consumer-grade camcorders. It was a smaller size than VHS, as with Betamax, but could be played in a standard VCR with an adaptor making the footage easier to access than ever before.

results.title: GoPro Hero 3
results.brief_description: The GoPro was designed as an action camera, making it as tough and durable as whatever adventure the shooter was partaking in. Originally invented for surf photography, they’re made to be attached to a body or moving object.

constellations_primary.name: Capturing first-person POV
constellations_primary.description: A comparison of how videogames and feature films have used first person POV shots and sequences and how (for the latter) camera technology has impacted on this.

results.description: They be little, but they be fierce: the GoPro was designed as an action camera, making it as tough and durable as whatever adventure the shooter was partaking in. Originally invented for surf photography, they’re made to be attached to a body or moving object. Body-worn cameras provide a new perspective on moving image and are linked to the term ‘sousveillance’, which describes the monitoring and recording of an activity by a participant in the activity itself (rather than surveillance, which refers to being watched by authoritarian figures). These types of cameras have been hugely popular in creating videos for social media and digital platforms.
description_for_label: They be little, but they be fierce: the GoPro was designed as an action camera, making it as tough and durable as whatever adventure the shooter was partaking in. Originally invented for surf photography, they’re made to be attached to a body or moving object. Body-worn cameras provide a new perspective on moving image and are linked to the term ‘sousveillance’, which describes the monitoring and recording of an activity by a participant in the activity itself (rather than surveillance, which refers to being watched by authoritarian figures). These types of cameras have been hugely popular in creating videos for social media and digital platforms.

results.title: Sony Handycam DCR-SX65
results.brief_description: The Sony Handycam DCR-SX65 debuted in 1985 and while other models from the era have been discontinued, it’s been made in various formats ever since. Home videos might have been their original purpose, but camcorders like this have captured footage that has social and political ramifications.

constellations_primary.name: A handheld aesthetic
constellations_primary.description: Looking at the use of handycams and other consumer level devices in moving image works.

results.description: The Sony Handycam DCR-SX65 is what it says: it’s a handy camera. Debuting on the market in 1985, its name came from its compact size that allowed it to fit in the user’s hand and capture their everyday lives more easily. While other models from this era have been discontinued, the Sony Handycam DCR-SX65’s popularity has seen it made in various formats ever since. Home videos might have been their original purpose, but their cost and convivence meant camcorders like this have been used to capture amateur footage that has social and political ramifications all around the world.
description_for_label: The Sony Handycam DCR-SX65 is what it says: it’s a handy camera. Debuting on the market in 1985, its name came from its compact size that allowed it to fit in the user’s hand and capture their everyday lives more easily. While other models from this era have been discontinued, the Sony Handycam DCR-SX65’s popularity has seen it made in various formats ever since. Home videos might have been their original purpose, but their cost and convivence meant camcorders like this have been used to capture amateur footage that has social and political ramifications all around the world.

constellations_primary.description: Since VR's inception creators have explored the ways VR could be used to enhance our lives and even extend them.
